result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua Karl Brooks in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered case Dismissed, But Read In.

Defendant Joshua Karl Brooks in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Court is in trial and defense requests additional time.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Karl Brooks in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter set for Sentencing. Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for reasons placed on record for Sentencing in branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Joshua Karl Brooks not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Defense counsel requests a sentencing hearing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 1:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.  Calendar call scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:  Any CVS;  6330 N 76th Street, Milwaukee WI; Co-Defendant: Rashad Lee.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua Karl Brooks in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Joshua Karl Brooks in custody.  
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserved, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
